sentences: Sild varises ja reisijad j채id rusudesse vangi.
context: The Estonian word 'vangi' is an adverb that can mean several things: 1) literally being imprisoned or taken as a prisoner, 2) figuratively being trapped or unable to move (like being trapped under debris), and 3) metaphorically being captivated or entranced by something (like someone's gaze). It appears in various compound words like j채채|vangi (ice prison/lake), lume|vangi (snow trap), tormi|vangi (storm captive), and tuulevangi (wind prison).
